activity.title: ohcnetwork/care_fe#12021
activity.text:
@amjithtitus09 I've tried applying the same approach to MedicationRequest questionnaire but it doesn't make a lot of sense to me in this situation…

1) When we add a new record and click the remove option before submitting, it will just remove the entry altogether, which is fine.

2) Seems that any  pre-existing/previously submitted records are read only, so user can not edit them anyways… by making the remove button no longer "disable" the row, UI wise it looks like nothing has changed (even though internally, the record status is being changed to "entered_in_error")

The way it is currently offers more feedback to user that something has changed

https://github.com/user-attachments/assets/7b5f1a70-f6b6-43e2-9a67-d6270773c173

activity.title: ohcnetwork/care_fe#12021
activity.text:
> @abeeto Works fine as per the linked issue. Could you do this for Medication Request as well? I had missed mentioning it in the issue.
> 
> Can you also remove the "Entered in error" options from the dropdown for all these during creation as that scenario wouldn't happen?
> 
> cc @nihal467

I've removed the "Entered in error" options from the dropdown for new records. I'm not sure what the desired behaviour is for MedicationRequest as there is no option to set the record as "Entered In Error".  @amjithtitus09 Could you please elaborate?

activity.title: ohcnetwork/care_fe#11966
activity.text:
> [@AdityaJ2305](https://github.com/AdityaJ2305) I have tried to solve this issue but I am not exactly getting where is the issue. The way in which _DiagnosisQuestion_ component is written differs a bit from how _SymtomQuestion_ and _AllergyQuestion_ components are written. These all components share common logic for while the form is submitted in _QuestionnaireForm.tsx_ but the problem is only occuring in the case of Diagnosis Form. I have checked for the logic part but I didn't find any bug there like all things are proper. I tried to remove the `exclude_verification_status` key but I guess it is responsible only to decide whether to show the `entered_in_error` rows to the user. Also other status are getting reflected only the problem occurs with _remove_diagnosis_, the status is getting to `confirmed` as if it is some default value.
> 
> I am not getting how to proceed from here. Can you help me out about exactly where I am going wrong.

I managed to get it fixed in my draft PR,  setting `dirty` prop to `true` in the `handleRemoveDiagnosis` fn did the trick.

activity.title: ohcnetwork/care_fe#12021
activity.text: Allow edit of questionnaires structured records even with `entered-in-error` status

activity.title: ohcnetwork/care_fe#11966
activity.text:
Hi could I please work on this?
My approach:
- records with `entered-in-error` status must have some state that is causing it to be disabled. This state should be overridden/ignored when editing.

As for the bug @AdityaJ2305 mentioned, I'm not sure what the expected behaviour is.. 
On submit, should the diagnosis table on Encounter page show the record with `entered-in-error` status? Because when I try to create a record with the `entered-in-status` or modify it, the encounter page either removes it from the diagnosis table.

activity.title: ohcnetwork/care_fe#11868
activity.text:
> ![image](https://private-user-images.githubusercontent.com/57055998/433918371-84a4cef2-3b53-4333-a4f4-914fc7f596a0.png?jwt=eyJhbGciOiJIUzI1NiIsInR5cCI6IkpXVCJ9..BgPC5CS12FTex3hvD8hE0Fmm6wj_3ZwWAxHTzjSFj_o)
> 
> * expand or tooltip is missing for truncated note as per issue

Hi, @nihal467 
The expand was missing because recent changes were made to the parent component, `TableCell` (only applied after you merged the develop branch). TableCell got a `whitespace-wrap`  added which is why my code was no-longer working, as I have a useEffect that needs to check if text is wrapping in order to render the expand.

Added a quick fix by just overriding the class to  `whitespace-normal`  for this particular `TableCell` element.
Please have a look now, should work!

activity.title: ohcnetwork/care_fe#11529
activity.text:
Hi, @Tanuj1718  @Jacobjeevan 
I see that this issue hasn't been fixed yet, could I please have a look.
Approach:
1) Add a `DialogTitle`, will wrap it in `VisuallyHidden` component so it's only for screen readers, assuming solution will look a little like this:

```
    <Dialog>
      {/* ... other dialog elements ... */}
      <DialogContent>
        <VisuallyHidden>
          <DialogTitle>Search Questionnaires</DialogTitle>
        </VisuallyHidden>
        {/* ... dialog content ... */}
      </DialogContent>
    </Dialog>
```

ETA: 1 day after assignment

activity.title: ohcnetwork/care_fe#11471
activity.text:
> I feel we should improve the UX here; instead of auto-fill, we could make this a tab section.
> 
> First tab could be: "By slot duration", second tab could be: "By number of slots", switching to any of the tab, should use that logic appropriately. 
> 
> 
> @bodhish thoughts? 🤔 
> 
> @abeeto feel free to pitch in better ideas.

Is there a use case for having the two options? Feel like they're both quite similar and in practice people would just one. 

From UX perspective, slot duration seems more useful because people won't have to do as much mental maths (can just say 30mins/session). But the logic for this would be more complex I think (how to divide sessions times as close to the slot duration provided)

activity.title: ohcnetwork/care_fe#11025
activity.text:
> Let's keep the solution simple, I'd say we can simply say update the label to "Description (supports markdown)"

True, we could just change the label to be "Description (supports [markdown](https://www.markdownguide.org/basic-syntax/))" and perhaps hyperlink "markdown" in the label to some markdown documentation. 

This way users who are unfamiliar with markdown can just click the link to learn more.

@rithviknishad do you think it would be nice to still have an example/template in the description as a placeholder as outlined? 

Either way, I'm confident I could have a  simple pr ready for review in a day or two :)

activity.title: ohcnetwork/care_fe#11025
activity.text:
Hi @abhimanyurajeesh , I think this would be a great first issue!

Here's what I would do if I were to be assigned:

-  Having a markdown template perhaps as a placeholder to only show the essentials ( headings, bold text, bullet points)
-  The markdown template would use example placeholder text pertaining to a facility/hospital to give users better context
-  more detailed information on using markdown by having a link next to the description label (perhaps using a tooltip)

A question I have is:
- Should embedding of images/urls using markdown be allowed on descriptions?

Additional considerations:
- I think the preview or rich in-built editors are also good solutions, that could be added later on.

If assigned, I'm confident I could have a PR ready in 1-2 days.
